titleStmt.title: Sir James Cambels Clarks disaster, by making books, shewing that lying and scandalous pamphlets against the King and Parliament are in great estimation, but bookes of learning and religion little regarded. Exemplified in a compendious letter to Iohn Philpond in Suffolke.
titleStmt.author: Browne, Edward.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
